summary:
My musical education started in the local music school at the age of 9, where I discovered the cello. In High
School I attended an orchestra music program. Upon finishing my basic education I went on to study Cello
with Lars-Inge Bjärlestam at Ingesund University. My conservatory education began in Odense, Denmark at
the National Music Academy of Denmark. My professor for the three-year bachelor program was the solo
cellist of Malmö Orchestra, Niels Ullner.
In his letter of recommendation, Professor Niels Ullner writes:
"[...] Petronella Torin ... is a serious and hardworking student. [She] combines her fine musicality and sense of tone
production with a strong ambition to constantly improve her playing which has really paid off during the last years."
I did an Erasmus year at the Maastricht Conservatory in the Netherlands, where I worked with Ursula Smith
(Professor, Guildhall School of Music, London & solo Cellist in Esbjerg Ensemble, Denmark).
For my master in "Music Performance", I choose the Royal Conservatory of Liège in Belgium and Professor
Jean-Paul Zanutel, solo cellist and member of the national ensemble "Musiques Nouvelles" in Belgium.
Playing the cello is not all I have been doing in my music education. When I was fourteen I started taking
singing lessons and today one of my specialities is to play the cello and sing at the same time. I am always
trying to challenge and expand the way of playing the cello. During a theatre project in the Toonelgroup
Maastricht I even played the cello while dancing.
In 2016 I started my own company called "A Swedish Cellist". "Take Away Concerts – Feed your Ears" was
my first project, the idea is that you can order a concert for your home like take away food. My mission is to
spread classical music and build bridges between people and music. I have since performed as "A Swedish
Cellist" around Europe, including in Belgium, Luxembourg, Germany & Sweden.
I have also so far interviewed more than 24 people for my podcast "Master in Music", with the aim to inspire
and spread valuable knowledge between artists and audiences.
Most recently, I have been working towards becoming an International Coach in Mental Training, following
a course from the Scandinavian International University in Sweden. My professor is Lars-Eric Unestål, the
founder of the Swedish model of mental training.

Seven talents are selected for each edition in the field of game, dance, music, design,
performance, choreography, direction and production.
For one month they work together on a presentation of collaborations that arise in the group: by
looking for duos and trios and exchanging these methods and arriving at something small.
They receive guidance from Paul Slangen, dramaturge Toneelgroep Maastricht, and Saartje
Hoogland, creative producer VIA ZUID.
The first edition of Talent Lab was Club Sandwich that played on 4 and 5 November 2017 in the
Bordenhal Maastricht.
The second edition of Talent Lab will take place on Saturday 21 and Sunday 22 April 2018
Talent Lab is a collaboration between Toneelgroep Maastricht and VIA ZUID.
